original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields close higher
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed higher on Thursday, dealers said while the interbank guidance peg remained unchanged.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 29.50/80 percent, steady from Wednesday’s closing at 29.25/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 closed at 29.10/25 percent on Thursday, steady from 28.85/29.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 closed at 32.10/40 percent on Thursday, unchanged.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions remained at 362.66 rupees against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 23/2023)
